benchmark_details.name: FACE-HUMAN-BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: The FACE-HUMAN-BENCH is a benchmark designed to evaluate the face and human understanding abilities of multi-modal assistants. It is constructed based on a hierarchical ability taxonomy and includes various evaluation problems derived from publicly available datasets in the face and human community.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of multi-modal assistants in understanding faces and humans, enabling improvements in application contexts such as media forensics, social interaction, and more.

data.source: Data collected from 16 public datasets in the face and human community.
data.size: Development set with 900 problems and test set with 1800 problems.
data.annotation: Semi-automatically generated with manual verification of problems.

methodology.calculation: Weighted accuracy of multiple-choice problems based on different abilities.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in understanding faces and humans.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through comprehensive evaluations over various mainstream multi-modal large language models.
